reviewText: This is one of the best movie Alexander Fu Sheng has make since Brave Archer.  This movie shows the audience why he is one of our favorite Asian actors.  Alexander show is winsical side to the audience along with his show of martial arts skills.

reviewText: "HSNT" is one of many films where Alexander Fu Sheng got to shine under another director other than Chang Cheh; here, it's Chu Yuan (Chor Yuen), who brought us films as like "The Lizard", "Intimate Confessions Of A Chinese Courtesan", "The Duel Of The Century", and "The Magic Blade", among  many others. Released in 1980, this down beat, plot-heavy fantasy (based on a novel by Gu Long) requires the viewer's attention in order to keep all the events straight, and to appreciate the whole affair of story twists, repeat viewings are a MUST! (As usual, no spoilers here.) Here, Fu Sheng's character is a somber one, atypical of his usual light-hearted roles, and the entire proceeding only has dabs of humor here and there, all in a dark vein. "HSNT" has fine fight choreography by Tang Chia (Tong Gaai), but it doesn't overrun the story, which will bother those wanting more action. The supporting cast is excellent, and it includes Yueh Hua (a standout), Ku Feng (always solid), Angie Chiu, Derek Yee, Chiu Ya-chi and Pai Piao. Many great-looking images abound, thanks to the cinematography by Huang Chieh. As a whole, anything that doesn't jell here is overshadowed by the quality work of ALL the production team involved!...This DVD, as has been mentioned by other Amazon reviewers, is NOT anamorphic widescreen; it's widescreen seen in a 1.33:1 format! Why Well Go USA, after all the other reissues of Shaw Brothers movies they've put out [in anamorphic], screwed up THIS film is disappointing. The advertised "Original trailer" is nowhere to be found, too, and either the original Shaw one OR the Celestial [shorter] one would be welcome here! At least, the English subtitles (typos aren't abundant, thank goodness) don't block any of the well-remastered picture. The Mandarin audio has enhanced sound effects and (possibly) added-on music cues, but they don't ruin the movie; the English dub seems to have less tampering. With all the gaffes this release has, should one pass up this disc? Considering the chances are very high this DVD will NOT be corrected at all, any fan of Alexander Fu Sheng should go for it, and if they do, make the buy while it's still on SALE, so they won't feel too cheated! As for Shaw Brothers fans in general, completists will want it, while casual viewers may pass it up for ANY Shaw reissue that's actually anamorphic! My rating does NOT reflect the DVD's flaws; I feel the movie is so good, that it's watchable with ANY SIZE picture. It's another unique Shaw film with the crowd-pleasing Alexander Fu Sheng, well worth all the efforts one takes to watch it, understand it and ENJOY it! <<FEB. 8 UPDATE! An email inquiry I sent to customer service at Well Go USA (on the 7th) about this DVD's shortcomings got the following reply....About the mention of a trailer, this was a mistake in the packaging's copy; they eventually "caught the error" ("This is something that slipped through on our part.") and are reprinting the DVD case wraps accordingly. As for the picture: "Unfortunately, we didn't have the 16X9 master to work from and will not be releasing widescreen." Give this rep CREDIT for giving me a reply AND honest answers! Such a quick, sincere response from Well Go USA will make me buy (or strongly consider buying) more of their product! For those still wanting an anamorphic "HSNT", get an import DVD (if you can live without language options) and a multi-region DVD player!>>....All the best, Brother Fang.
summary: You're gonna need to see it MORE than once....

reviewText: It was a great film. This movie is proof positive that the shaw bros made the best sword play movies. The plot is a bit complex and it has a few slow parts but its still good enough for 3 stars.  The movie does have a few red harrings and an intresting twist at the end.  The picture and sound quality is excellent. You can watch the movie in either english or chinese subtitles or in chinese of english dubbed sound tracks if you prefer. It indicates on the dvd that it has a trailer on the dvd as well , but i couldn't find it.
summary: Interesting little twist at the end!

reviewText: I love almost all of the Shaw Brothers martial arts movies and I always enjoy movies starring the venoms. Alexander Fu Sheng is terrific is this movie. By looking at the cover of this DVD, I was hesitant for a long time to purchase it, but finally I gave in and bought it. The movie turned out to be a great movie to watch. If you enjoy Shaw Brothers films or films starring Alexander Fu Sheng, I highly recommend this one.
